MINUTE 2.Confidential Annex?(loth August, 1943 at 5,30 p*nu)I,ITALYTreatment ofAlliedPrisonersof War- in italy.The War Cabinet were reminded that, inaccordance with the decision taken at the Meetingof the Defence Committee (Operations) on28th July, 1943* the Prime Minister had sent a message to the King of Italy,- through the SwissMinisters in London and Rome, to the effect that ifany British and Allied Prisoners were transferred from Italy to Germany^ the Italians could expect nomercy, A satisfactory reply had been received tothis communication, and the Swiss Minister inLondon had learned that his colleague in Rome hadreceived a satisfactory assurance on the pointfrom the Italian Foreign Minister,'THE PARLIAMENTARY UNDER SECRETARY OF STATEFOR FOREIGN AFFAIRS said that it had been made clear to the Swiss Minister in London that the Italiansmust appreciate that our threat in this matterapplied,not only to prisoners in Italy who had been captured by the Italians themselves, but to all british and Allied prisoners in Italy by whomsoeverCaptured, and that they must all be retained in italy. He had been asked to ensure that the SwissMinister in Rome made this perfectly clear, and our minister at Berne had been instructed to take upthe question on the same lines with the swiss government,The War Cabinet took note, with approval,of the action taken.Offices of the War Cabinet,S.W.1,17th August, 1943,H D.0.(43) 6th Meeting.
